verses.roman:
ajāya janayitre 'sya
brahmaṇe 'nanta-śaktaye
parāvarātman bhūtātman
paramātman namo 'stu te

synonyms: ajāya—to the unborn; janayitre—the progenitor; asya—of this (universe); brahmaṇe—the Absolute; ananta—unlimited; śaktaye—whose energies; para—of the superior; avara—and the inferior; ātman—O Soul; bhūta—of the material creation; ātman—O Soul; parama-ātman—O Supreme Soul, who are all-pervading; namaḥ—obeisances; astu—may there be; te—unto You.
translation: Obeisances unto You of unlimited energies, the unborn progenitor of this universe, the Absolute. O Soul of the high and the low, O Soul of the created elements, O all-pervading Supreme Soul, obeisances unto You.
